description: Creates an AD Connector to connect to a self-managed directory. Before you call ConnectDirectory, ensure that all of the required permissions have been explicitly granted through a policy. For details about what permissions are required to run the ConnectDirectory operation, see Directory Service API Permissions: Actions, Resources, and Conditions Reference.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The fully qualified name of your self-managed directory, such as corp.example.com.

parameters.name: Password
parameters.description: The password for your self-managed user account.

parameters.name: ConnectSettings
parameters.description: A  DirectoryConnectSettings object that contains additional information for the operation. The identifier of the VPC in which the AD Connector is created. A list of subnet identifiers in the VPC in which the AD Connector is created. (string) --- A list of one or more IP addresses of DNS servers or domain controllers in your self-managed directory. (string) --- The user name of an account in your self-managed directory that is used to connect to the directory. This account must have the following permissions: Read users and groups Create computer objects Join computers to the domain.

nested_params.name: VpcId
nested_params.description: The identifier of the VPC in which the AD Connector is created.

nested_params.name: SubnetIds
nested_params.description: A list of subnet identifiers in the VPC in which the AD Connector is created.

nested_params.name: CustomerDnsIps
nested_params.description: A list of one or more IP addresses of DNS servers or domain controllers in your self-managed directory.

nested_params.name: CustomerUserName
nested_params.description: The user name of an account in your self-managed directory that is used to connect to the directory. This account must have the following permissions:

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to be assigned to AD Connector. (dict) --- Metadata assigned to a directory consisting of a key-value pair. Required name of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters and cannot be prefixed with 'aws:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---', --:', --@'(Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$'). The optional value of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---', --:', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: Required name of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters and cannot be prefixed with 'aws:'. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---', --:', --@'(Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The optional value of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---', --:', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_items.name: DirectoryId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the new directory.
